text: The Tachikawa Ki-54 was a trainer aircraft used by the Imperial Japanese Army. It was called "Hickory" by the Allies for it's codename. The aircraft was made because of a requirement by Imperial Japanese Army that they needed a twin- engine advanced trainer for training the crew. There is a Ki-54 fuselage in the storage at the Australian War Museum Annex. ==References== Category:World War II Japanese aircraft Ki-54, Tachikawa
title: Tachikawa Ki-54
